poem:
Dark Gold

In fields distant, silent,  
the cocoa's fate trembles,  
rooted in soil that knows  
the tongue of fire and storm.  
Lush green turned ash,  
as man's hunger waxes.  
Silent, the earth sighs,  
a warning hidden in shadowed  
pods that whisper of fragility—  
sweetness slipping through  
fingers of an unseeing world.
